Reviews.Title: “Best option off strip”
Reviews.Author: Deejub
Reviews.Content: This is where how to write a review -- the standards from which to judge -- are hard to decide. This is simply the best possible option off the Strip. The rooms are new, with widescreen TVs (with a very large selection of channels, rare in LV, including several in HD), friendly staff, and prices that are lower than far inferior properties. If you have a car, this is not only a better choice than any of the other off-strip properties, it's a much better choice than most of the Strip properties. However, it is clearly not in the same class as the highest-end Strip properties, which are true five-star resorts. You wouldn't want to honeymoon at the Eastside Cannery, but I wouldn't want to spend $200-400 a night when travelling alone with a car. Following my preference to rate within the property's class, this being my first choice by far in the area within its class, I rate with 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “The and Kindest in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: DrRobinRushlo
Reviews.Content: From Feb 28th to March 5th I was there a meeting. The staff and floor people and just everyone went out of their way to make sure I was ok and taken care of. I have stayed on the strip many times and being 100% blind been ignored and forgotten off to the side and has to wait up to an hour to find some one to help get around or find a place in the hotel or casino. I would give then a rating of "10" if I could just that great.

Reviews.Title: “First Time To Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Whitehouse I
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Cannery to watch Michael McDonald. It was our first time in Vegas and we were both aprehensive. It was awesome. We had a corner suite on the 14th floor that overlooked the south and east. The morning sun over the mountains was incredible. Even as the sun set in the south the colors of the mountains would change. Rooms were great. The only semi negative is the house keeping needs to take a little more time to detail. We had no towels or soap when we arrived and they didn't pick up like you would think. Really, dig stinking deal. We loved it. Were from Ohio so were use to non smoking everything. The smoke in the casino was noticable but not overwelming. We never went back to our room with the stench of smoke all over us. it was fine, no biggie. The dealers were awesome. Very helpful, informative and generous at times $$$$$. John is a great dealer, we always looked for his table. He was great to talk to and very explained the rules great. The entertainment was good at both the bars inside the casino. Neither drowned eachother out. If you want to go to Vegas but don't want to deal with the crowds on the strip and just want to relax this is the place to be. We have all ready been making plans to return. Make sure you say hi to Richard the gangster bit boss, very nice guy.

Reviews.Title: “I'M LOCAL< I THINK IT IS REAL NICE- THE ROOMS ARE AWSOME”
Reviews.Author: tracy z
Reviews.Content: Ok in reading some of the reviews, If you cant handle the smoke go to a smoke frree casino, if you want a better neighborhood, go to the strip, if you want music go to a club. You know you cant please everyone! For your money the room we stayed in in was better than any room on the strip for your money. Went to a concert and was very pleased......Were going back for the third time, we get a room and do a concert so we dont drink and drive, and we live there, it like going on vacation.!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Jacuzzi Suite at the Eastside Cannery”
Reviews.Author: gapcmp
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I attended the MIchael McDonald concert at the Eastside Cannery and spent the night in an 11th floor jacuzzi suite on property. The property is fairly new and in excellent condition overall. Dined at their very fine restaurant, Carve. You can't go wrong. Corner suite overlooking the North and Western part of the Las Vegas valley.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but.....”
Reviews.Author: spiderwoman_11
Reviews.Content: The staff were extremely helpful and friendly upon arrival. The room was spacious and very nicely appointed. However, it was apparent that housekeeping was not thorough in cleaning. The lamp had layers of dust on it, for example. Our room was not cleaned the second day and even though we reported it, the room was never cleaned that day. We had to ask for fresh towels which they did send to our room. However, the next day, housekeeping did clean the room and change the linens.

Reviews.Title: “Eastside Cannery, Las Vegas, Nevada”
Reviews.Author: dennyj_7
Reviews.Content: Stay there for only one night, January 29, 2012. The rooms were very nice sized and had a refrigerator in the room. I wish the Las Vegas hotels would put a coffee pot in the room, I had to go down to the cafe to get coffee and it was quite expensive. The machines were not paying off for us when we were there. They do have some old fashioned coin machines in one area if you like hearing the coins drop in the tray. This is one of the newer hotels off-strip and is still in really good shape. The buffet was quite good for the price.

Reviews.Title: “clean, roomy”
Reviews.Author: ehsane
Reviews.Content: the room was very clean. I liked the free parking. customer service was not that much welcoming. also the neighborhood was not very good.

Reviews.Title: “We love the east side cannery”
Reviews.Author: islandtime05
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel great front desk staff actually everyone on staff is nice. Shelly the front desk manager is wonderful to work with and as a business guest it is a very nice and clean hotel. They do need to circulate the air better in the casino. but the rooms are lovely the view is awesome. The hot tub is very nice large and hot!!!!!!! The pool looks beautiful but they do not heat it so I was not able to use it. We consider this our gem of a hotel as the prices are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a little music!”
Reviews.Author: awomansopinion
Reviews.Content: The rooms were large and very comfortable. However, the casino seems too quiet. Could use some music (or louder music?). And can they offer coffee with cheaper refills? I had to go to McDonalds every morning to be sure I had enough coffee without paying full price for refills. They do have an excellent buffet for just $7 on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms - smokey lobby”
Reviews.Author: EastwestUSA
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last weekend for 3 nights. The room, a double queen, non-smoking was very comfortable. No smoke odor, very comfortable beds. Unfortunately, when you enter to go the registration, you enter the casino which has a nasty smoke smell. Worse at night when it's busier, better in the early morning. We didn't try the restaurants because they open to the casino, and again, the smoke. If they could fix that, it would truly be a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay and played...fun fun”
Reviews.Author: rurka
Reviews.Content: We went for a concert and the room they gave us was amazing. The restaurant downstairs was great food and go, check in was quick and they gave us extra bar drink coupons beacuse we had to wait a few minutes which didnt bother us at all. Love it and when we can afford Veagas again we will stay there. The casino was fun, and was glad we were off the strip. Easy parking which we always had a problem when we went on the strip. I think it is overall a one stop stay and play.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked our New Year at Eastside Cannery”
Reviews.Author: Kentworth
Reviews.Content: We regularily stay in Vegas for shopping, golfing and gambling holidays. This time we chose Eastside Cannery. Boulder Highway is close to everything we want. A rental car and TomTom led us to multiple shopping malls and golf courses. Our room was well above average and we won enough to pay for it. Do not hesitate to eat in EC restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Plumbing problems”
Reviews.Author: westie2
Reviews.Content: The rooms would fall into the mid-range in terms of size and quality though on 2 of the 3 occasions we experienced problems with a dripping shower heads. The major difference between the regular and deluxe rooms is the latter has an extra set of floor to ceiling windows and a Jacuzzi. Rooms boast a flat screed TV and a small refrigerator. There is no swimming pool or parking garage. On our last stay we got a good senior rate and were upgraded to a deluxe room. Dining options: Casa Coscina – this is another Tex-Mex restaurant serving uninspired and mediocre food. Snaps – we have dined at this coffee shop 3 times for breakfast and enjoyed each our meals. Carve – we have had dinner at this restaurant a total of 3 times as well and highly recommend for anyone seeking a high quality to price ratio. The deli is adjacent to the sport book and was disappointing. We have not dined at the small buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Not Veteran Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Sigrid Z
Reviews.Content: My friend and I who are both Veterans went to the coffe shop for breakfast on Veterans Day. We asked if they had a discount for Veterans and the answer was no. Most Casinos and other restaurants here in Las Vegas give a free to a Veteran on this our special day. The answer was NO !!!! We stayed for breakfast anyway at the coffee shop and the service was terribly slowwwwwwwwwwwwww. Will never go back !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I Love THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Lancashirebob47
Reviews.Content: I would encourage anyone to try this hotel. It is lovely, especially the bedrooms and the amazing views. it is not expensive, especially if you are a senior you will get a reduced rate. I just wish management would put a free shuttle bus from the airport to the hotel and perhaps an excercise room would be a bonus. I look forward to going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice mid level property”
Reviews.Author: SecretAgentReview
Reviews.Content: Great modern rooms with plenty of light. The property quality is above the service level which is ok. Some are very helpful. The evening desk person was, rude condescending and unprofessional. I made the error of explaining a problem with my room. I used to look forward to staying here. This was my first bad experience at the property however it was so stinging in its effectiveness to make me not want to return. I believe she is the night auditor. With her attitude she should be in back of house ONLY. The day manager later apologized Flatscreen TV with plenty of channels. Good gaming. The air is fairly full of smoke which makes it difficult for a non smoker to tolerate some area. Never realized how many people were addicted! Food is average and priced accordingly. Specials for players card holders are good value. nicest property in the boulder strip area

Reviews.Title: “Modern, trendy and quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Herman1960
Reviews.Content: Our third visit to the Eastside Cannery Hotel at Boulder Highway (eastside of Las Vegas) was as pleasant as the two visits before. Staff is (mostly) not as friendly as somewhere else, but they are helpful. We asked for a cornerroom and we got 1301, a cornerroom on the 13th. floor with a fabulous view at the Las Vegas strip and the (many) airplanes approaching Mc.Carran Airport. Always a nice and amazing view. Rooms are large and spacious and have floor to ceiling windows. The rooms are well equipped, have very good beds, a 42 inch TV with HD-channels and the bathroom is good as well. We had pleasant nights here, again !

Reviews.Title: “In love with the rooms”
Reviews.Author: MrsSawicki
Reviews.Content: My husband and I has stayed in this hotel 3 times since it's opening. It is incredibly affordable and the rooms are nicely decorated. Big flat screen and extremely comfortable bed. The only thing I noticed this time was a whole conversation by our next room neighbors. Walls are sort of thin. Also there was an empty bottle of wine cooler in one of the garbage cans. Obviously was overlooked by the cleaning crew. Overall, it's an excellent option for staying off the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money and great fun!”
Reviews.Author: WayfaringStranger13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eastside Cannery for 2 nights before moving to the MGM Grand on the strip for 2 nights. I must say that in every way, I preferred the Eastside Cannery. The rooms were just as nice, if not nicer. I appreciated having a frig in the room, which MGM Grand's room did not. The table limits are lower, and the food prices are more reasonable. The buffet was good (not great, but for $7.77, certainly well worth it). The hotel's Mexican restaurant and their fine dining restaurant (forgot the name) were excellent. All of the staff for the hotel as well as the gaming staff were very friendly. The price of renting a car and staying at the Eastside Cannery was still significantly less than the cost of just staying at the MGM Grand. With so many places offering free parking on the strip, I wish I'd stayed at the Eastside Cannery the whole time and just driven to the strip, which is only about 10 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and reasonable”
Reviews.Author: livsgoobie2
Reviews.Content: Room large and comfortable. Staff nice. Food passable. Service good. Small casino with lots of smokers but not that crowded as to be uncomfortable. Travel to and from airport can be expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: SEMoSyreen
Reviews.Content: The rooms were well appointed & super clean. All the staff were very friendly and accommodating. The buffet was great and I even won a little money. Can't beat the price either! No problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: TomPorter413
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the Cannery and had good luck gambling. Vegas still smokes and does here as well. All was good, however I had asked when we made reservations how to get out there from the airport as we were meeting friends and didn't have a car. We were told to hop a cab and the price should be around $25. You can imagine how my blood boiled as I watched the meter reach $60 from the airport out to the hotel. I believe we only paid $35 for the one night stay at the hotel. We could have rented a limo for $80.

Reviews.Title: “A gem- a nice change of pace from the hustle & bustle of the LV Strip hotels.”
Reviews.Author: Ciaobaby000
Reviews.Content: We visit Las Vegas a couple of times a year and usually stay in an MGM property, as we did for the last two days of our visit this time. But, we decided to stay here for our first night in LV because it was close to Sam Boyd Stadium and we wouldn't have to trapse back to the strip in the wee hours of the morning when our event ended. We were pleasantly surprised, the room was very clean, modern and had a floor to ceiling window view-pretty cool window. The room was very quiet and the bed was super comfortable. We also had a 32" LCD in the room-very nice touch. We hit the Mexican food resturant before we left for our event-nice and quick, good food. The service and staff at this casino/hotel were very good, I would not hesitate to return and stay another time. It is roughly about six or seven miles (15 minutes) down to the LV strip, but I understand there is a shuttle that stops here frequently. If you are traveling to LV and have a car to get you around this little gem is worth the stop, great rates too. Thank you, Eastside Cannery - we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Local Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1943Hepburn
Reviews.Content: This hotel on the Boulder Highway is a smaller hotel which makes it very comfortable....no long corridors to walk, no gigantic casino to walk through before you get to the rooms. We enjoy staying here because the price is definitely right, the rooms are comfortable and a good size. The floor to ceiling windows are great and the view from the hotel is lovely from all sides. We have stayed at the hotel twice so far and have found the housekeeping to be adequate although we have had some plumbing problems which they attended to promptly. The cafe has good tastey food. We haven't tried the buffet yet but we are booked for December this year and hope to give it a try this time around.

Reviews.Title: “Casino and Hotel Away from the Crowds”
Reviews.Author: libertychef
Reviews.Content: If you want to be near the excitement of Vegas--the shows, the crowds, the lights, the five-star restaurants, and the glamor, don't stay here. If you prefer to stay where there is a cool casino, delicious every-man's restaurants and an adequate room at an adequate price...this is the place. For those who complain that it is far from "The Strip," be aware that The Cannery is located in NORTH Las Vegas. That does not mean the north part of the strip, that means an entirely different location on the map (i.e.North Dakota is not in South Dakota). I love The Cannery. It has all the games I play and prefer. My money lasts a long time, I love the Mexican restaurant and the diner, and the room is up to date and extremely clean--not to mention the players' points are very generous. The parking lot is huge with a short walk to your room. When reviewers complain about the distance to the Las Vegas strip, I'm guessing they didn't check out where The Cannery is located on a map.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vegas hotel off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: World Passport
Reviews.Content: The negative thing about this hotel is the check in process was slow. They only had 1 person on a Saturday night? Internet for $12.95 per 24 hour is very slow. The 2 queen bed deluxe (standard) room is very spacious and clean. The beds were comfortable. The room comes with a small fridge and a wall hair dryer that actually works quite well. The buffet was not good. The coffee shop called Snaps was okay but the service was slow. The Mexican food was alright. The Deli in the back of the casino is actually better but they mostly serve hot and cold sandwich. I will definitely go back to this hotel. I hope nobody trashes this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice alternative off strip if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: libertybell
Reviews.Content: Newer property than others off strip. Very nice newish room, but a little worn around the edges. Clean and comfortable w/flat screen TV (and lots of channels for a change), large split bath area with deep soaking tub, floor to ceiling windows, refrigerator, but the bed was a bit soft and there is no safe. Elevator is room key activated for security, small but functional pool area (think Holiday Inn), cheap eats and drinks at the pool ($2-6 drinks and beer and $5 burgers, etc). Several reasonably priced restaurants and a very good steakhouse Gambling has all the options, but was tight as a drum. No winning here for us. Lots of good specials throughout. Main negative is the location. Wouldn't stay here without a car though as it doesn't have a free shuttle (like Sams Town down the street).

Reviews.Title: “We were pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: jgschoo
Reviews.Content: Our visit to Las Vegas was for a basketball tournament that my granddaughter was participating in. Since money was tight we found a great bargain at Eastside Cannery. We didn't really expect much for the price but were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is fairly new and was very nicely decorated, the beds were very clean and comfortable. The view from our seventh floor window was fantastic.. The pool area was really nice with little cabanas. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The only things I didn't care for was the casino smoke, just passing through but I guess that's to be expected and the lighting in the bathroom a little too dim for my liking.It is about 15 minutes from the strip. I will stay there again when I go back to Las Vegas. Thank you Eastside Cannery for three lovely days.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT...If you know what to expect!”
Reviews.Author: Row21Middle
Reviews.Content: Purpose: Leisure Length of Stay: 4 Nights Rate: $29.00/night Overview: If you're the right person., staying at this hotel will be like hitting the jackpot! Pros: -Everything in our room was brand-new and immaculate; seriously, I wouldn't mind eating off of the floor. -LOVED the huge flat-screen TV with high-definition programming and lots of channels -Room was extremely quiet -The view of the mountains and Vegas skyline from the 12th floor was absolutely beautiful to wake up to each morning -The Deuce (city bus) stops right alongside the hotel and will take you to The Strip -So many on-premise restaurants and buffets to choose from -Cheapest room rates in Vegas, and NO resort fees! -Pool looked wonderful and well landscaped Cons: -Hoards of elderly people (I'm in my 20's and occasionally felt out-of-place) -Takes around 30 minutes to get to The Strip -More of a locals casino than a vacation resort. This hotel is perfect if: -You're 40+ and don't enjoy the hustle and bustle of The Strip -You're on an extremely tight budget -You're staying for 3+ nights -You have a car

Reviews.Title: “Concert Rip-Off! Do not attend concerts at this hotel/casino!”
Reviews.Author: mjane2004
Reviews.Content: Do not attend concerts at this hotel; very, very disappointed!!!! I booked a two night stay because I purchased a ticket to see Brett Michaels in concert at this hotel/casino. The concert was absolutely a rip-off. After Michaels' first song, the Cannery's entire sound system went out; all we heard was muffled music from the stage. Several of us actually went straight to the sound system tech and complained about the situation just to be told by him that there was nothing they could do about restoring the sound system!!...and they did not. Michaels' cut his concert short playing for just over an hour... a $100.00 concert ticket rip-off and scam, indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Eastside Cannery!”
Reviews.Author: crystalswa
Reviews.Content: We visit Las Vegas several times a year and usually stay in a Harrah's property, as we did for the first five days of of visit this time. But, we decided to use our free room comps at the Eastside Cannery for our last two nights. We were pleasantly surprised, the room was beautiful and had great views. The room was very quiet and the beds were super comfortable. The air conditioning unit was a little loud, but I like white noise so it put me right to sleep .The tub/shower was big and spacious. We enjoyed playing commission free pai gow in the casino. The pool was a little inconvenient, you have to walk through the casino, and out the door and use you your room key to unlock the gate to get in, but it was decorated nicely and very peaceful. All of the service and staff at this casino/hotel was very good, I would not hesitate to return and stay a whole week the next time. It is about 6 miles down Ttropicana to the strip, but the deuce bus stops here frequently.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff-great $7 Sunday buffet-Casual dress”
Reviews.Author: Sunnyside01
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the laid back atmosphere here-unlike the pulsating energy driven strip; Nice place to just sit back & chill out; Enjoyed the horse race betting area, there is a roped off area that contains a few "classic" slot machines that take a quarter & spew quarters from below, to winners; don't think any other place in Vegas has such machines. Sunday $7 buffet was great ! From breakfast items-eggs Benedict (even omelets made to order) to catfish, pork loin, all kinds of salads, veggies, & desserts; drinks were included in the price. Some parts of the casino seemed smokier than others but other than that, had a perfect time for the price. Very casual dress, did see many seniors there -especially Sunday-probably locals who know a bargain..

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: Jhall113
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was very clean, the hotel staff was wonderful, the rooms were Awesome. The hotel is not on the strip however this was one of my most enjoyable hotel stays in Las vegas... JOB WELL DONE.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: IvoriSalmon
Reviews.Content: Just got back from long weekend here. Wonderful place w/ lots of parking. Casino was pretty smoke free compared to others and huge variety of slots. I had lunch at Snaps; it was ok, I think I expected abit more from a club sandwich tho. The Sunday buffet was cheap ($7 all day) and food was decent; what do you expect for $7? Staff were all friendly and courteous. I prefer a place off the Strip and Cannery was great; not crowded at all, even when busy and not filled w/ crazy tourists. Room was large w/ a great view from 12th floor; everything clean and comfortable too. Would def stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Alternative Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: World Passport
Reviews.Content: Stayed in their deluxe room for 3 nights for business. The room is clean and spacious. Room service was very quick. Not sure how old the casino is but the room looks fairly new. Internet is only $9 per 24 hour. The only down side is the A/C is a bit on the noisy side. Food in the 24 hour coffee shop is huge. Buffett is not that good but cheap. Have never seen that many penny slot machines. Located about 6 miles away from the Strip. If you want to save money on hotel rooms and get a nice room in Vegas, this is the hotel for you. Have stayed in many 4 star hotels in the Strip but the rooms were just okay. This is slightly better than average 4 star room hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Alternative”
Reviews.Author: Demoknite
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you have a car and want to save a bit of money. I believe this hotel caters mostly to locals who might be getting drunk in the casino and dont want to drive home or people who visit Vegas for the gambling and not the glitz of the strip. The rooms are super large and very clean with a big flat screen TV. Great views of mountain vistas and a distant view of the strip are available. I didnt eat here, but assuming you are staying here you have a car so you have all of Las Vegas at your plate. This is a hidden gem for sure.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: leianna19
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying here and at first I was skeptical because I felt that the the reviews were to good to be true. I was wrong. When we got into our room I could not believe how clean and large it was. I loved the windows and the view was breathtaking being on the 10th floor. I have a 18month old son who stood at the window all night watching the lights and eventually fell asleep. The bathroom has a huge tub and is very nice. The beds were comfortable. Overall the room was great and it has been the best room we have ever stayed in. We travel every other month to Vegas and we have found our new hotel that we will always be staying at. The best thing about this hotel was the service. The front desk were very nice and check in was very easy. The Valet Crew are THE BEST. I never seen a more energetic, friendly, and helpful crew. They always had my son smiling and had us laughing while waiting for our car. I've been to other hotels and they worry more about getting the job done and not their customers. Well all i can say is we will be there next month and will continue to enjoy our stays there. Thanks Eastside Cannery Staff =)

Reviews.Title: “Issue with a broken jacuzzi and window were dirty inside and out.”
Reviews.Author: ladygirl11
Reviews.Content: After finding the jacuzzi had a mechanical isuue (which we found out at 11 p.m.) we realized the windows were also dirty on the inside and out. No one was at counter when we checked out in the morning. I called to talk to shift manager later and she basically said she would let maintenance know but to bad about my romantic night! Extremely disappointed in the way it was addressed and the lack of concern..

Reviews.Title: “Good with the bad!!”
Reviews.Author: Franko2
Reviews.Content: Very nice modern new hotel well away from the strip. In order to get you there they are offering some very good prices. That's the good part, now the price you pay for that great rate. The registration desk is in a corner of the casino so you must register and sign out as well as eat in the smoke filled casino....YUK As well they nickle and dime you to death for everything $12.00 per day for internet, $1.25 per phone call etc. Also get a room at least at level 4 or above to avoid the music noise from the casino bars. Kind of takes away from the good rate ..... just be careful & no what your getting.

Reviews.Title: “Good place off the strip”
Reviews.Author: subithere
Reviews.Content: Quick 15 min to strip large clean rooms with comfy pillows. No microwave or coffee pot in rooms.Would have been nice if free internet was offered.

Reviews.Title: “Best off strip”
Reviews.Author: vegasguy61
Reviews.Content: Only stayed a couple nights but wish it was longer. The room was great. Like others have posted try to get a corner room, that is what we got and it was very large with a great view. It's not that much more and worth it. As for eating, the restaurants were all good. I would definitely recommend room service. We got our dinner in about 20 minutes and the waiter set us a table by our floor to ceiling window. Presentation was great and the price was not much more than Snaps downstairs. When we were done eating we climbed in bed to watch a movie on the large screen LCD but we probably enjoyed the view more than the flic. Made for a nice romantic weekend. If you are looking for a hotel in the area, this is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay off the strip”
Reviews.Author: RickyJGirl
Reviews.Content: Great hotel to stay at if you don't want to be part of the hustle bustle of the strip. My fiance and I love this place and have stayed at this venue 4 times already ... looking to stay for Superbowl/birthday weekend. My fiance said we can stay at a 5 star for my birthday but in my eyes, this is a 5-star hotel. Why spend $$$$$ on other hotels when we can stay here at a reasonable price, in comfort with exceptional views, every angle of Las Vegas. Pros: deluxe rooms, ask for corner rooms (301, 901, 1101, etc.) and you'll get a room with ceiling to floor windows overlooking the entire Las Vegas strip/valley. Double queen beds, extremely comfortable. Mini refrigerator. Nice size tub/shower. Nice size flat screen tv. Ample of plugs to charge phones, etc. Nice size desk to conduct business overlooking the entire city. Quiet hotel overall. Staff always courtesy and willing to serve you. Great sports bars with a lot of big screens/tvs for all you sports fanatics. Bank of America and Walmart directly across the street. Sam's Town, neighbor and another hotel that's not so clean and desirable across the street as well. Why do you need the strip .. I guess if you want to be part of the big crowds. You can drive there not that far away. Cons: None really. Just wish they offer complimentary Wi fi ($12.99 24-hr use). But with the affordable rate, I guess I can't complain. Another wish, a coffee pot would be a plus. I would never stay anywhere else. Closing remarks. I love this place. If you're the type of person who just have to stay at a high-end trendy hotel, then this may not be for you. But, if you are a reasonable person, then you will enjoy this place for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Off-Strip Option”
Reviews.Author: peterbob
Reviews.Content: We had an extra night in Vegas & chose this place because it was relatively new, about two years old I think. It is also away from the hustle & bustle of the strip, so if you need a break from that this is a pretty good choice. Plenty of slots & video poker & the casino layout is very user friendly. All of the restaurants are on one side of the casino, the gaming tables are in the middle of the casino floor surrounded by every type of slot imaginable. There is one bank of elevators that serve the hotel tower, so navigating your way around in here was not confusing at all. The rooms, gaming areas, public areas & restrooms are all fairly new & therefore are in great shape. The Longhorn Casino is across the street to the west & Sam's Town is up the street to the north, in case you want to casino hop a bit. There is also a Walmart nearby if you need to stock up on anything. All in all, a nice choice for staying off-strip & I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel and Casino!”
Reviews.Author: Tovin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Eastside Cannery for 3 nights in October during the Las Vegas Ren Faire. We avoid strip hotels, and while we enjoy the downtown experience, we're not as familiar with driving around downtown on weekend nights, so we looked for something off strip. The great service started with reservations. I was paying for two rooms for 3 different people, and didn't want to confuse the reservation system with my name on both reservations with different rooms on the same credit card. I emailed the hotel and got a quick response from the Director of Hotel Operations, who painlessly made the second reservation. I was impressed! When choosing our hotel we looked for value rates as well as casinos that could provide good cocktail service at our low roller rates. We were not disappointed! Parking was excellent, with lots of available spaces which dramatically cleared up after 6:30pm. This really is a locals place, so the early and late crowd did not exist on our trip. Checkin was fast, efficient, and we had no problems at all. The elevators were awkward, as you must swipe your room key before choosing your floor. With all our bags and checkin paperwork, it was a bit of a challenge. I appreciated the safety idea of needing it, but we saw a lot of people riding the elevator who were lost as to picking a floor, and simply got off when we did. Which reduced the appearance of safety, in my opinion. The rooms were HUGE! We had two queen beds on the 11th floor. The room was well appointed, with great views of the strip (if you placed your face against the glass), mountains, a local park, the subarbian houses close by, and in general peace and quiet. My one issue with the room is that it could have used another trash can. (How's that for nit-picking?!) Plugins were readily available both on the bathroom sink area as well as next to the table/lamp area. We paid $85 a night per room before taxes. We had a fridge, two comfy queen beds, a raised top/bar area seperating the bathroom and the living area which was convienent for throwing phones and items on before passing out in bed for the night. The flatscreen TV did not turn on in a deafening volume mode! There were a few hangers, and the lotion, and conditioned shampoo were appreciated by my husband. (I bring my own!) Our one issue with the hotel was lack of ice. Our floor (11) did not have ice, nor did floor 10, or 12. We did not complain, but our travel-mate did. She was told it was probably because people were filling up coolers. We found this hard to believe on Thursday night, Friday morning/afternoon/evening and Saturday morning. However, after she complained a few times the ice machines were working on our floor. We appreciated the response, and will definitely let the front desk know next time, if there are any issues. The casino staff was FANTASTIC! The dealers were great, the tables were cheap $5 BJ 3:2 payout, $2 roulette with 50 cent chips, $5 pai gow poker, and a ton of nickle video poker. There were tons of penny and nickel slot machines, and the types of games seemed to be fairly new, and a lot of fun. We were impressed with the promotions going on, but for people who only visit Vegas every 4-5 months we will probably not get the same response as locals, as their players club seems to reset points every 90 days. But we all got a pint of tequila and a pint of rum for our 3 days of play, and we entered into their Saturday night giveaways and one of us ended up winning $25! Not bad for a weekend promotion clean up!! Drink service was AMAZING! We really enjoyed the coffee shop, though their special was not impressive in cost or food amount (though it was yummy). I loved their country fried steak and eggs and biscuits and gravy was a great deal. This is not a traditional "cheap" eatery, but the food was hot, drink re-fills were quick in coming, and the service was friendly. We did not try the deli or room service. The hotel is across the street (almost directly) from a Bank of America, and Wal-Mart Supercenter. Awesome for us to fill up on soda and water for the room. Overall what made this hotel a keeper for us was great drink service, fantastic rooms, and cheap casino play. We will definitely be back shortly, and often!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; will return”
Reviews.Author: donmil2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night in 2009, and one night in Sept 2010. Very relaxing atmosphere. Every employee we contacted was positive and friendly. The room was very nice, and this year we had a great view of Vegas. I will return!

Reviews.Title: “Our New Place in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: HonestReviewForU
Reviews.Content: Saw this place from the road a year ago. It was all lit up at night and we went to take a look. Fast forward to this year and we decided to stay there. The $29/night rate (honest - and no ripoff "resort fee") brought us in, but the place had no trouble in winning us over. Just two years old (as of 8/10), the casino in the Eastside Cannery caters mostly to locals, but the hotel is not overlooked. Our very big room had floor-to-ceiling windows with a view toward the Strip. The place was spotless, and there was even a fridge (a rarity in LV), though, oddly, no coffeemaker. No big deal. Beds were very comfy with good pillows. Didn't go for the $13/day wireless Internet, but the big flat screen TV was nice. There's a coin laundry (3 washers/3 dryers) on the third floor, another rare find in this own. One thing: You must have a car to stay here. It's on Boulder Highway, about a 10-15 minute drive east of the strip. There's a bus that runs from the hotel along Flamingo Road, but LV bus service is notoriously awful, and can only be worse when it's 107 outside. We've been to MGM, TI, NY-NY and others, but Eastside Cannery beats them all. It's a really nice place at a really great price, and you don't have to walk down endless corridors to get to your room or to the car. No, you won't have the experience of staying on the Strip. But you'll save more than enough to buy something nice when you get there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property”
Reviews.Author: TopekaDucky
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at Eastside Cannery and were pleased with the property. I believe the hotel just opened about one year ago, so the room was clean and still had a new carpet smell. Nice modern-looking furniture, comfortable bed, earthy colors, and the staff provided good service. We ate the buffet for supper and while not as large as some on the strip, we found plenty of good options and thought the cost was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Eastside Cannery Hotel.... a locals casino with great rooms”
Reviews.Author: iloveartist
Reviews.Content: Stayed at eastside during the Memorial Day weekend-Fri,Sat,Sun and not only was it one of the more affordable rooms $59,59,38 but we avoided spending over $100 plus per nt on the strip. Floor to ceiling windows, nice comfortable king size bed, frig and big bath tub, new furnishings , big screen tv. My wife and I loved the deli at the Sports bar-- quick service , affordable prices and nice staff for breakfast, lunch , lite dinner. The service at the cafe can be long which is why we loved the deli. they have a small poker room that attracts good local play for their 7pm $25 poker tournament. the pool is a kiddies pool that was an afterthought. "What about the pool?" "uh-oh" "Hey, put it in the parking lot we have plenty of room" And that''s what it looks like.

Reviews.Title: “A Jekyll & Hyde experience on this trip”
Reviews.Author: ArchieHOP
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here almost exactly one year ago and was very impressed on almost all levels. So I didn't hesitate to stay here again. This time I came away a little surprised. First off, was treated rather rudely at check-in. Upon arrival on Thursday for a three-night stay I was told that the king non-smoking room I had reserved six months prior was not available; that they only had eight king rooms in the whole hotel (That would surprise me). I accepted a double queen but asked about any possible free upgrades. From this point on the gentleman actually got snotty. He said no because I was staying three nights and he could only give me an upgrade for one night. He then threw (yes threw) my credit card and identification back on the counter so that I had to stop it from sliding across and on to the floor. He then did the same thing with the room key packet and basically dismissed us by turning his back without bothering to tell us what our room number was, where the elevators were (we at least already knew that) or even wishing us a good night. Horrible! The room, as last visit, was wonderfully clean, roomy, and very comfortable. Strange thing, though. We left the room on Friday at approximately 10am and returned about 8pm and the room had not been touched by housecleaning. We had to call down to get clean towels. The room was cleaned on Saturday fine. Again, strange. The gaming as always is very fair. You get to play and sometimes even win. The casino is roomy and really not very smoky unless you are sitting right next to a chain smoker. The cocktail waitresses are abundant and very friendly. It makes for a nice gaming session. We ate at two restaurants while there. Snaps is your standard 24-hour cafe/diner. The food is a bit average but the service is great and the prices are very reasonable. But had another interesting experience at Casa Cocina. Although the food here was VERY good the waiter was about as attention deficient as I have ever seen. For the most part we seemed to have to deal with the bus boy, who was at least accommodating. The waiter on the other hand showed up only to take the food order, delivered the meals (there were six of us) in spurts, and never bothered to check on how we were doing. We wanted to order another round of drinks but were never able to. All the while he was running around like the proverbial headless chicken and ended up dropping a meal on the floor at the table next to us where it sat for 10 minutes. It also took over 30 minutes to get our check after we finish, again without ever checking if we needed anything else (drinks, more drinks!). Next time we're here and want Mexican food we may just go over to Willy & Jose's at SamsTown about a block away. We'll see. I also noticed that their nightclub, Club One-Six was no longer open. Wasn't a big deal to me but thought it seemed popular last year. Another casualty of the Vegas economy I guess. Overall, not a bad stay, just weirdly non-consistent this visit. I will stay here again but sincerely hope the rough edges get smoothed-out.

Reviews.Title: “Great room for only $30”
Reviews.Author: JoeyH01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights. The comfort and attractiveness of this room rivals rooms that I have spent four times as much for. As long as you have a car, this is a great option for anyone looking for a nice room at a value price. Food service is also good. It's about a 15 minute drive to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Made us feel like we were welcome!”
Reviews.Author: benefitrep
Reviews.Content: Friendly caring staff through out the whole establishment!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: mickisovick
Reviews.Content: Very nice and plush at a great, the secret with this hotel is to call the hotel directly... they have rooms directly from there reservation department M-Th for 29.99 p/ night

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: solea04
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel of the strip by far. The rooms are very clean the bed is comfortable along with the pillows which are a big thing with me for a good nights rest. The room had a great view the room service was great. It's located not to far from Lake Mead and other local destinations. The only draw back that I have with the hotel is,when it's time to check out and you are just a little late checking out they start to hassle you mainly the room floor manager and the front desk by calling.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lancashirebob47
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 5 days at this lovely hotel. Although a little way off the Las Vegas strip if you have no car, no problem as the bus stops right outside the hotel. The bedrooms are large and spacious with all modern amenities, floor to ceiling windows,with great views. The only criticism I dare mention is it would have been nice to have access to an excercise room ( there isn't one at the moment). I look forward to going back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Eastside Cannery is popular among locals. Not so much with me.”
Reviews.Author: heart_caribbean
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Eastside Cannery for 4 nights as it was the reception location for a friend's wedding. Both the bride and groom are Las Vegas locals and when I see on the site, "Voted #1 by locals" I had pretty high expectations of a fun place. Check in was very smooth and our room was upgraded complimentary, which is a great start. The room was huge with very large whirlpool tub plus separate shower. Definitely the biggest room I have seen in Las Vegas. And the value per night was excellent. Generally, the service was good. Our room was cleaned everyday. The casino is well lite with many games to play. My disappointment was the casino was very smokey, to which it is Las Vegas and I did not expect a health spa or anything. But a smoke free room with a single treadmill or elliptical would have been appreciated. There are few healthy food options throughout the casino/hotel. When it comes to nearby spectacles, be like a local and take the bus because there isn't much within walking distance. Upon checking out, I left my make up in the room and when I realized a few hours later, my hours trying to recover my items was useless despite my cooperation with casino security. Two weeks later they sent the make up bag to me but all of the contents were gone. I know this is my fault for leaving it in the room, but it was disappointing that despite my recovery work my items were gone. Next time I'm in Vegas, I will stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Eastside Cannery Exceeds Expectations”
Reviews.Author: SteveGee
Reviews.Content: In October I stayed at the Eastside Cannery for the first time. What a great hotel!!! I had a deluxe room which was grreat. The entire staff seemed very warm and friendly. Food quality was excellent and I enjoyed all of their restaurants. The dealers were nice as well and tried to be helpful. I have since recommended the Cannery to three of my friends and assoociates and look forward to returning soon. My hat is off to Kimerberly Hollowy and her terrific staff. Thank you one ans all. S.G. of South Florida

Reviews.Title: “Comfy rooms, good player's club”
Reviews.Author: jb2186
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very nice and fancy looking. Didnt have all of the mismatched wallpaper and paintings. Employees were nice and helpful. Bus to downtown strip was right outside the hotel. Good drink specials and fun player's club! Definitely be a member of this one! Night club hours are strange..

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice rooms and casino”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBBoomers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights last week. We wanted to stay off the strip to save some $$ and we were on our way to the Grand Canyon anyway. If you have a car, it's easy enough to get to the strip or downtown. Originally, the check-in clerk put us on the 6th floor but after seeing the casino rooftop from our window, we went back to the desk and she gave us a room on the 11th floor without any problem. The rooms are large, with a floor-to-ceiling window. Beds were very comfortable. There was no smoke smell outside of the casino and it was very quiet all night. The casino itself was large with a good variety of new slots and $5 BJ tables. Drink service was very good. It was really quiet in there on Thursday night, a little more crowded on Friday but still easy to get any machine or get a seat at a BJ table. I found the slots by the elevators to be tight but they seemed a little better on the other side of the casino. My wife and I played for several hours and came out fairly even. Overall, a very nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for tight budget”
Reviews.Author: mainer5
Reviews.Content: The rooms were a great value for the money, $29.00 weekday and $59.00 weekend. My wife didn't like all the smoke in the casino. We both like to take outside walks while on vacation, but decided it may not be a safe area for walking. The hotel has a good buffet for the money, that we both enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Rooms- Lobby/Casino was Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: JennWA
Reviews.Content: The rooms were great, spacious with a bar, modern furniture. The whole hotel is only a few years old. The window in the room was huge floor to ceiling glass with an awesome view of the Vegas lights very beautiful. The staff seemed spaced out and indifferent. They weren't particularly rude or anything they just seemed out of it. It was a little disturbing. The only real negative to this hotel and its a big one is the stench in the lobby. It reeked of cigarette smoke- the smelliest cheapest cigarettes I am sure. It was so bad that by the time you got to your room you felt dirty and contaminated which really detracted from the beautiful room. The elevator was horribly stinky as well. Another thing which disgusted me was that this casino was very popular with the local gambling trash (apparently the winnings were good here) and they were here in droves. I do not like seeing a bunch of smelly trashy people on the way up to my room on a daily basis- so although the price was unbelievably low and the room was great I'm not sure I would stay here again or feel comfortable recommending this to a friend. Also, no free breakfast or free internet which was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning.”
Reviews.Author: suki5150
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days and found the Eastside Cannery a total pleasure. The room was amazing, the pool spotless and quiet. A fabulous buffet that was great value and a brilliant price. Good slot choice with a fast and friendly cocktail service with great girls. Only good things to say about this off strip joint.

Reviews.Title: “Best Price for the Value”
Reviews.Author: sunytrvler
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean, beautiful and spacious. For only $29.95 a night, it was great! The only complaint is that the casino is smokey. I didn't think my room was, but some of the people I was traveling with did. The room service was quick and very delicious! I wasnt feeling well and ordered hot tea through room service later, which they didnt charge me for. The check in check out was easy and no wait. I went to the cafe for breakfast, where service was a bit slow, but food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: cliveasmith
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 night's over the last weekend in May. Not bothered being off strip as this was not a first or second visit to Las Vegas. We have stayed on strip, off strip and downtown before plus we always have a car. The hotel is OK but I don't think we will ever return to stay, maybe to eat as the food is good. We actually prefer next door to this hotel, Sam's Town for ambience. The room was nice with large window's and also kept clean. From the look of the fitting's they look like they will age quickly, so in a few short year's the place could look pretty tired. We did not eat at their buffet, it had just reopened but when we went it was seafood night which is not our favorite. We did eat at their sister hotel the Cannery and that was very good, one of the better one's and very reasonably priced. If the Eastside's is as good as that one, it would be worth the effort to go back. We tried using the pool, saw the wristband thingy but ignored it as there were only a handfull of people there and the attendant never asked. There was a family with 3 kids turned up after about 10 min's and the kid's were screaming their head's off and anoying everyone, so within 20 min's they had the pool to themselves as everyone left.

Reviews.Title: “The greatest decision in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: cbrownsfan42
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Las Vegas to play in the World Series of Poker. I booked 1 week at the Eastside Cannery. Just a side note i have stayed at about 30 different casinos in Vegas. This place is amazing. Quick check in complimented with coupons and a friendly desk person. The rooms are better then advertised. plenty of room and seating within the room. The bathtub could fit 2 people very comfortably. Housekeeping is immediate as well is the room service. The buffet is one of the best in town and the hotel provides you with 2 for 1 coupons at the players club desk. delicious cuts of prime rib, italian, chinese and american food is always provided. On wednesday the seafood buffet is second to none. I earned enough points at a couple hours of gaming to get 2 free seafood buffet coupons. The gaming center is great too. the dealers are all friendly and the floor managers are very socialable and helpful. With many table games and slots to play you will always have something to do. They hae a small poker room but it is more then enough to host there nightly texas hold em tourney. $25 entry and a pretty good pay out if you cash. The bar also has a really good band to provide you with live music any evening. As a matter of fact the casino was so much fun I never made it to the rooftop lounge. (sorry). Traveling to the strip was never more then 10 minutes, even during rush hour. And for $30 a night this place is weel worth the short drive. I have no complaints about this place and if they continue down the same path i will be staying here every year I come to Vegas. I promise you won't regret it.

HotelInfo.Name: Eastside Cannery Casino & Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 5255 Boulder Highway, Las Vegas, NV 89122
